name: Texas Muslim Womens Foundation Inc
mission: Founded in 2005, Texas Muslim Women's Foundation (TMWF) aims to empower, promote and support all women and their families, with a special focus on North Texas. We are an equal opportunity provider. We engage all members of the community – women, men, seniors, families and youth through our various programs. We provide social and family violence services that foster peace and well-being in the home through our Peace in the Home Services and Peaceful Oasis Shelter. In addition, TMWF also arranges leadership skills development for Muslim youth to inspire the next generation to build a promising future for our society and educational programs for Muslim and non-Muslim community members to learn about topics essential to individual and community welfare.
theoryOfChange: The Texas Muslim Women's Foundation (TMWF) has a published report titled "From the Roots of Trauma to the Flowering of Trauma-Informed Care". This report details TMWF's four-year project to design and implement culturally-sensitive trauma-informed programming for domestic violence survivors and their children. It outlines their process of becoming a trauma-informed agency, which included learning about types of trauma and trauma-informed care, assessing existing culturally-sensitive practices, identifying new practices, training staff, and collaborating with researchers to document and build a body of evidence-based practice, all while maintaining a survivor-centered approach. The report articulates a model that integrates culturally-sensitive services and trauma-informed advocacy, which TMWF invites others to learn from and replicate.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.tmwf.org/ways-to-give (Source: https://www.tmwf.org/ways-to-give)

strengths_deep_dive: Texas Muslim Women's Foundation demonstrates a strong commitment to its mission through steady financial growth and efficient operations. With <cite id="2">$4,665,216 in total revenue</cite> and a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 86.0%</cite>, the organization effectively channels resources to its core domestic violence programs. Their exceptional fundraising efficiency of <cite id="5">$0.03 to raise every $1</cite> ensures that donor contributions are maximized for impact. Furthermore, their <cite id="6">98.66666666666667/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> provides donors with high confidence in their accountability and transparency.
rich_narrative.summary: Texas Muslim Women's Foundation empowers survivors of domestic violence through culturally sensitive social services and leadership development. Founded in <cite id="1">2005</cite>, the organization provides comprehensive social services, youth development, and education programs designed to improve well-being within and beyond the Muslim community. The organization reported <cite id="2">$4,665,216 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. They maintain a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 86.0%</cite>, directing funds to critical services like emergency shelters and transitional housing. The charity is <cite id="4">zakat-eligible</cite>, ensuring donations reach those in need according to Islamic principles. They operate with high efficiency, spending just <cite id="5">$0.03 to raise every $1</cite>. The organization has earned a <cite id="6">98.66666666666667/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting strong financial health and accountability. Over the past three years, the organization has experienced a <cite id="7">17.3% revenue CAGR</cite>, indicating steady growth in community support. In 2023, they successfully <cite id="8">housed 186 survivors in shelters</cite> and supported <cite id="9">204 survivors in transitional housing</cite>.
